Name: Huscarl Captain
Description: A captain of the fame Huscarl warriors who are one of the fiercest infantries in Europe. Loyal to the king he swear an oath to, this Huscarl captain will fight to the death along with his troop.

Name: Thane
Description: Saxon thane (or thegn) is the landowner, which is considered to be a minor noble title in Saxon England. Thanes are responsible for governing their local land and raising the militia (fyrd) to respond to the call of war by their king. After the Norman invasion, William the Conqueror replace Saxon political structure with Norman's one and integrate the thane class to Norman knight class.

Name: High Medieval Minor Noble
Description: In the time of inefficient record, it is impossible to keep track the name of every person who was the leader of the army units let alone participated in the battle. History oftentimes remembers only the major nobles who were the top in the chain of command, but it is important to know that no army can be led by such a few individuals even for an organised mass. These minor nobles were one of such people that often joined their lord army as a minor leader or warrior.

Name: High Medieval Noble
Description: Not even an important noble would be assuredly recorded in the chronicle of a battle in the time of pre-industrialisation period. The majority of battles in world history did not have historians to record the event or its existence as the well-known battles we know today, some may even be lost to the flow time, accident or intentional erasing. These unnamed nobles still without a doubt aided their sovereign as commanders of the contingent in the battle.

Name: imy-rA mSa
Description: Ancient egypt army overseer or vizier.

Name: Ur
Description: Ur is one of the word that refer to a person of status in the Ancient Egypt language. Nobles in the Ancient Egypt society are only below the Pharoah himself and usually serve as a high ranking leader of the military.
